text: Hello, I have a question regarding the HubSpot connector in airbyte. I connected HubSpot to our data warehouse a few days ago and everything seems to work fine. The only problem is that I don’t get the data from custom made ticket properties in our data warehouse (using Postgres). The custom made ticket properties appear as columns in the ticket table in our data warehouse, but they don’t have any values inside. I already tried different sync modes in airbyte, as well as syncing the data raw and normalized. Does anybody have experience with the airbyte HubSpot connector and could give me some advice on that specific problem? Thanks in advance! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi <#C2YHAHB6K|api>, I'm new to Hobspot and trying to create a custom object calling `crm/v3/schemas`endpoint using private app access token that has the following scopes:
• `crm.objects.custom.write`
• `crm.objects.custom.read`
• `crm.schemas.custom.write`
• `crm.schemas.custom.read`
but on calling the endpoint I keep on getting an error message saying:
```The scope needed for this API call isn't available for public use. If you have questions, contact support or post in our developer forum.```
Can anyone help.....I will really appreciate the help

Offcourse <@U25PYL3Q8>. I tried the following:

• Submissions by source which returns no error but an empty result: `<https://api.hubapi.com/analytics/v2/reports/forms/total?start={stardate}&end={enddate}&f={guid}&d1=sources>`
• Conversion pages: I use the following call   to extract the form stats per day. `<https://api.hubapi.com/analytics/v2/reports/forms/total?start=%s&end=%s&f=%s>' %(date, date, guid)` But for analysis purpose I would like to have the conversionpages per form as is show in the HubSpot portal used by our marketeers. 
For both calls Authentication is done via a Bearer token. I'm able to receive correct data from other api calls I make but I'm not able to make these 2 specific drilldowns. Hope you can help! Thanks!
we need a hubapi sdk for react js
is that available

Question about batches, why does the typing of the batch api (in TS) can return BatchResponseSimplePublicObjectWithErrors which led to think that an answer can contain errors AND results while it always crashes if there's a single error ?
For example it would be nice (and normal for a batch API) to be able to do the job for as many entries as possible and return the results per entry (being an error or a success)
atm if you send 2 contacts to the Batch Create api and one of them is already in HubSpot you just get a 429 for the request
I was expecting a response with 2 entries : [ "OK", "CONFLICT" ]
so instead i'll have to go on each records and make a search beforehand (not very rate friendly)
any insight on this ?
Hummm ... another strange thing : How can 5 parallel searches hit the rate limit ?

> • The search endpoints are <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details|rate limited> to four requests per second.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
hooo thank you didn't see the search line
this doc is just... :face_with_rolling_eyes:
like the 100 per 10 secs which is actually 10 per seconds
mathematics
yes if you multiply it's ok... but it's still not the same :smile:
and this
is just plain confusing

Hey Rushin, not a direct solution for HubSpot but our <https://docs.nango.dev/docs|aggregated CRM API> supports this (for HubSpot and 11 other CRMs at the same time).

In essence you integrate with our REST API once and get contacts syncing (including information on new/deleted contacts) for 12+ CRMs.

Let me know if this is of interest to you to try and I can set you up with some free credits.

Can someone update documentation or at least post here what the required scopes for creating custom objects via a private app
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>
FYI you can't create custom objects with oauth tokens from normal apps but for a private app the required scopes are: `crm.schemas.custom.read crm.schemas.custom.write`
is that the miniumum?
<https://share.getcloudapp.com/P8u7b7A7>

I mean I just tested it and the only scope you need in
```crm.schemas.custom.write```

Hi there. I work for a company that has a saas app that's support a few users against HubSpot using our own integration. Our integration uses api keys right now, and I want to test a new feature we're working on and only just discovered that we'll have to get tokens working soon.

The problem is that we cannot create new api keys in the UI. Is there any way to generate an API key anyway? We won't be adding token support in the next week or two, at least, since we have other features we are currently working on.

Thanks in advance!
Nope there's no way to generate new hapikeys just Private apps
I was curious if anyone knew if there is an API for building on top of the 2 way sync platform native to HubSpot?
Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>
Thanks <@U25PYL3Q8>
Yeah for sure
what was the issue jamiu?
Creating custom object is available for only enterprise account, while my account is just a free account
Anyone here have a solid understanding of HubSpot’s oauth2 capabilities in terms of client ids and claims?
Thank you very much <@U25PYL3Q8>!
What is your use case?

<@U01QVR44MEY> do you know if all private app tokens have the prefix `pat-`? I assume that means "personal access token", and if it's always that prefix, it makes our transition to these kinds of tokens a lot easier.
<@U0438QBBB8Q> Yes I can confirm that all private apps have the prefix of `pat` (private-app-token I think) this helps differentiate between private apps tokens and oauth tokens.
